sense.name: way
sense.commentary: a line leading to a place or point
sense.examples: He looked the other direction. George didn't know the direction home. Fido pulled George in the direction toward home. He checked the direction and the velocity of the wind.

sense.name: not spatial way
sense.commentary: a general course along which something has a tendency to develop
sense.examples: I couldn't follow the direction of his thoughts. His ideals determined the direction of his career. They proposed a new direction for the firm.

sense.name: guidance
sense.commentary: counsel, counseling, counseling - something that provides direction or advice as to a decision or course of action
sense.examples: Career counseling is a form of guidance that every school should offer. Many couples seek guidance in the form of marriage counseling only after they're separated. Stock brokers are often hired to provide guidance as well as do their customer's trading.

sense.name: management
sense.commentary: DIRECTION[+event] the act of managing something
sense.examples: steering, guidance - His direction of the project lasted two years. He was given overall direction of the program for six months. Was the direction of the economy in 2001 a function of government? A new council was installed under the direction of the king.

sense.name: instruction
sense.commentary: commission, charge, command - a message or describing how something is to be done; or a formal statement of command or injunction to do something
sense.examples: He gave directions faster than she could follow them. The judge's direction to the jury...

sense.name: focus
sense.commentary: focusing, focussing, centering - the concentration of attention or energy on something
sense.examples: The direction of activity shifted to molecular biology. He had no direction in his life.
